channel.title: Automatic Tutorial List
channel.description:
Well, let's face it. The tutorial list at the mo' isn't being updated... at all. So I whipped up a quick automatic tutorial list maker that reads X number of pages of the section, sorts them, and then spits out the BBC for me. I understand that abraham2119 did this before, but for some reason that I don't know/remember, it got removed/not used. If the staff agree, I will gladly either give the source, or post the thread myself and update it frequently. Even if they don't, I'd still like some suggestions (which is why I post this here)
Here is an example of what it outputs: http://paste.strictfp.com/4751
I'm not going to post it here (as it is close to the 20k character limit), but to see what it looks like, just c+p that BBC from the paste and 'preview post' in either quick reply, or 'new post'.
Suggestions? (particularly 'category' suggestions + keywords)
EDIT - Now has the ability to create lists for any board by changing one number, a final string (just for some aesthetics), and you can easily change the keywords/categories.
Also added the ability to sort by title, author name, views, and replies
New example output: http://paste.strictfp.com/4756 (reply sorting) http://paste.strictfp.com/4757 (author sorting) http://paste.strictfp.com/4758 (downloads list)

item.title: Automatic Tutorial List
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote="(Anthony), post:31, topic:390937"][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=486885.msg3574525#msg3574525 date=1303318786]
Nice. Can it sort at all or anything?
[/quote]
it does alphabetic iirc.[/quote]Sorry, I meant like categorize. If you look at the current lists you can see what I mean. Someone on the IRC (I think it was Thug-life?) said there wasn’t really a point of these type of lists if they couldn’t categorize, because that’s what people really look for when searching downloads etc

Read full topic

No, I don’t want it to output an HTML file, I’d probably just make it edit a certain thread.

I’m pretty sure there is already a mod for this for SMF, I’ve seen it before.
[/quote]As in, generating a list of threads? Or do you mean automatically editing a certain thread, or what?[/quote]

http://custom.simplemachines.org/mods/index.php?mod=2194
Moparisthebest, have a look at that.

item.title: Automatic Tutorial List
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Muroth, post:17, topic:390937”]Maybe a PHP file using mysql getting the author, title, id from the database and using mysql, update a thread?
Edit:
Maybe, like:
http://moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,". $db->id .".0.html]". $db->title ."[/quote]Using PHP it would be extremely easy, you just look at the source of the boards and modify it a tad so it changed the HTML to BBC. If Moparisthebest wants to do that, that would definitely work. I just feel (personally) that there should be some sort of community effort put into it, whether it be manually updating the thread with the generated BBC, or using a program like this to make the BBC written by a member of the community.

Read full topic
